message.subject: Guarantee from EEFT of Enron Australia Finance
message.content:
M1.1. Paul
[Conventional: salutation]
M1.2. further to my email/voicemail on our attempts to get an Exempt Market
Declaration issued to Enron Australia Finance Pty Ltd (EAF).
[Inform: this email is a follow-up to previous email and voicemail]
M1.3. I now have a
specific request to put to you.
[Inform: David has a request for Paul]
M1.4. It appears that we would qualify for such a Declaration thereby allowing EAF
to use the safe harbour provisions under the Australian Corporations Law for
trading through EnronOnline if EAF had get a guarantee from Enron Europe
Finance and Trading Ltd.
[Inform: it seems that David et al. qualify for an Exempt Market Declaration, allowing EAF to use safe harbor provisions for trading through EOL]
M1.5. We would be able to take advantage of a specific
provision in the policy guideline of the Australian Securities and
Investments Commission on the grant of Declarations known as Policy Statement
70.
[Inform: provision they can take advantage of is in Policy Statement 70]
M1.6. (Below is a summary of the relevant provisions of the Policy Statement.)
[Inform: summary of relevant provisions presumably attached]
M1.7. Would the provision of such a guarantee be possible?
[Request-Information: would provision of such a guarantee be possible]
Flink1.7
M1.8. Clearly an issue to consider would be any possible impact on EEFT's
prudential requirements under the Financial Services Act.
[Inform: possible impact on EEFT's prudential requirements needs to be considered]
M1.9. If this were an
issue perhaps could it be overcome if there was a back to back guaranty from
say Enron Corp. to EEFT.
[Inform: possible way to overcome such an impact]
M1.10. This mean that effectively EEFT would have no
additional exposure.
[Inform: in this case, EEFT would have no additional exposure]

message.subject: Guarantee from EEFT of Enron Australia Finance
message.content:
M2.1. Paul,
[Conventional: salutation]
M2.2. further to our discussion last Friday.
[Inform: this email is a follow-up to discussion in previous email]
M2.3. Attached is a complete copy of
Policy Statement 70 referenced in my earlier email.
[Inform: Policy Statement 70 attached]
M2.4. Paragraph PS70.50
contains the statement that authorisation under the SFA is considered to be
an adequate regime for monitoring capital adequacy.
[Inform: relevant paragraph pointed out]
M2.5. The SFA oversight must
apply to either the entity that is trading under the Australian Exempt Market
Declaration as or its guarantor.
[Inform: what SFA oversight must apply to]
M2.6. It is also in the this paragraph that the
reference to "low risk firms" is made.
[Inform: reference to "low risk firms" made in previously pointed out paragraph]
M2.7. Once you get a response to your enquiries we look forward to hearing whether
the provision of the guarantee is feasible.
[Inform: David et al. would like to know whether provision of guarantee is feasible after Paul's inquiries are responded to]
